org.purewidgets.client.application
Class PDApplication

java.lang.Object
  org.purewidgets.client.application.PDApplication

public class PDApplication
extends Object

The PDApplication class represents a running public display application on the client side (browser). It defines an application life-cycle for the various states of a public display application. (Currently there is only one state but in the future more states will be added for a more fine-grained control of the application execution.)

A public display application is associated with a Place and has a unique applicationId within that Place.

A PDApplication cannot be directly instantiated. Instead, applications must call load(PDApplicationLifeCycle, String) that will instantiate a new PDApplication object and load from the InteractionManager server the existing information about the application. This is typically done in the onModuleLoad of the GWT module: 

 @Override
 public void onModuleLoad() {
                
     PDApplication.load(this, "PublicYoutubePlayer");
 }
 
 @Override
 public void onPDApplicationLoaded(PDApplication app) {
     this.pdApplication = app; // save the reference for later access if needed
 }
This code will load the current application and trigger an onPDApplicationLoaded event when done. "PublicYoutubePlayer" is simply a default id for this application. Typically the application id will be loaded from an URL parameter (applicationid); the same happens with the place id, which is also loaded from an URL parameter (placeid).

After being loaded, a PDApplication will have a LocalStorage and a ServerStorage instance associated with it.

A PDApplication provides a standard way to read and store application parameters: name/value pairs that are stored in the ServerStorage, but that can be overriden by URL parameters with the same name.

Author:
Jorge C. S. Cardoso

getParameterBoolean

public boolean getParameterBoolean(String name,
                                   boolean defaultValue)
Gets a parameter value interpreted as a boolean. This method calls getParameterString and then tries to convert the result to a boolean. If it cannot convert, returns the defaultValue.

Parameters:
name - The parameter name to retrieve.
defaulValue - The parameter's default value to return in case the parameter's name does not exist.
Returns:
The parameter value, or defaultValue if the parameter name does not exist or if the value cannot be converted to a boolean.

getParameterFloat

                               float defaultValue)

Parameters:

defaulValue - The parameter's default value to return in case the parameter's name does not exist.
Returns:
The parameter value, or defaultValue if the parameter name does not exist or if the value cannot be converted to a float.

getParameterInt

public int getParameterInt(String name,
                           int defaultValue)
Gets a parameter value interpreted as an integer. This method calls getParameterString and then tries to convert the result to an integer. If it cannot convert, returns the defaultValue.

Parameters:
name - The parameter name to retrieve.
defaulValue - The parameter's default value to return in case the parameter's name does not exist.
Returns:
The parameter value, or defaultValue if the parameter name does not exist or if the value cannot be converted to an integer.

getParameterString

public String getParameterString(String name,
                                 String defaultValue)
Gets an application parameter. Application parameters are stored at the ServerStorage, but can be overridden by URL parameters. This method first checks if a URL parameter with the given name exists, and if not, checks if a parameter with the given name exists in the ServerStorage. If no parameter is found, returns the defaultValue.

Parameters:
name - The parameter name to retrieve.
defaulValue - The parameter's default value to return in case the parameter's name does not exist.
Returns:
The parameter value, or defaultValue if the parameter name does not exist.

getPlaceId

the placeId

Returns:
The ServerStorage associated with this PDApplication.

setParameterString

public void setParameterString(String name,
                               String value)
Sets a parameter on this application. Parameters are saved to the ServerStorage.

Parameters:
name - The parameter's name.
value - The parameter's value.
